Detailed Description

template<int size, class T = double> template class Vector

The class Vector provides functionally equivalent to a ColumnVector object.

The class Vector is derived from the ColumnVector class and therefore provides similar functions for the Vector objects.

Example Program: See the Example program for class ColumnVector.

Vector ( const Matrix< size,1,T >& matrix ) [inline]
 

Conversion constructor to convert a matrix of single column to type Vector.

Member Function Documentation

Vector< size,T >& operator=<size, T> ( const VectorBase< T >& vectorBase ) [inline]
 

This function overloads the assignment operator to assign a VectorBase type to a Vector type. Both objects must have the same dimensions.

Parameters:
vectorBase   The object of the base class VectorBase.

Reimplemented from ColumnVector.

MatrixInitializer< T > operator=<T> ( const T & elementValue ) [virtual]
 

This function provides an overloaded assignment operator to initialize a vector object.

Parameters:
elementValue   The value to which all elements in the vector are initialized. The initialization of the vector object can also be done as a comma seperated list. For example: 
Vector<3> myVector;
         myVector = 903.9046, 89, 589.579;

Reimplemented from ColumnVector.
